title: About Me
text:
I like pumpkins.


Get an ecological data scientist position.



M.S. Natural Resources and the Environment Data Science Graduate Certificate B.S. Environmental Science




2024-2026 Graduate Research Assistant University of New Hampshire • Project (funded by the Harvard Forest LTER): From Rhizospheres to Canopies: How Eastern Hemlock Mortality Affects Soil Carbon Pools • Collected soil from the Harvard Forest Hemlock Removal Experiment • Processed samples for soil carbon and nitrogen stocks • Assessed canopy health and dynamics via Google Earth Engine

Summer Undergraduate Research Fellow 2018 Abisko Scientific Research Station (Abisko, Sweden) Advisor: Ruth Varner Project: Fate of Dissolved Organic Carbon in a Subarctic Watershed • Executed project in remote arctic Sweden for 13 weeks • Collected and processed water samples for dissolved organic carbon measurement



Dec-Aug Lab and Field Coordinator 2024 Trace Gas Biogeochemistry Lab (University of New Hampshire) • Coordinated winter field work operations at local field site • Onboarded and directed seven lab members • Performed and oversaw data collection from basic soil analyses • Performed winter soil respiration sampling and subsequent GHG analysis
2022-2023 Research Assistant Trace Gas Biogeochemistry Lab (Durham, NH) • Performed daily snow and soil frost measurements • Assisted in the collection of soil samples • Processed soil samples for textural and C:N analysis
Summer Conservation Easement Monitor 2022 Greenland Conservation Commission (Greenland, NH) • Walked conservation properties to determine easement violations • Identified tree and wildlife species present including invasive species • Created individual property reports including maps (QGIS), permitted activities, and official conservation status



dos Santos Teixeira, C., Tansey, P., Frey, S., & Contosta, A. (2024). Land use moderates the impacts of changing snow regimes on soil freeze-thaw and soil greenhouse gas losses. In AGU Fall Meeting Abstracts (pp. B31Q-1509).
Tansey, P., Persson, A., Spry, E., Chanton, J., Johnson, J., & Varner, R. (2018). Carbon transport in a subarctic permafrost peatland catchment area. In AGU Fall Meeting Abstracts (pp. B31H-2585).
Thanks for checking out my web site!
